text: when I was 16 and 17 I used to have a
Saturday job in a jewelry shop and
that's when I learned that the markup on
diamonds was really almost criminal
because a man would come in full of joy
and he'd buy an engagement ring which in
those days might've costs 200 quid say
and then a month later he'd come back
wanting to sell it back to the shop and
we'd give him 30 or 35 quid that was it
he had been robbed as well as jilted and
you could see the ones who were going to
come back you could see the doubt in
their eyes and we converted that doubt
into hard profit by selling them
worthless chips of rock it's tough isn't
it that's why I'm not married think of
the money I've saved I could have a
massive train set instead but what about
gems those cut and polish monsters that
hang provocatively in the cleavages of
Joan Armatrading Journal of Elizabeth
Taylor Kim Kardashian is Shh Kardashian
yes they are relatively rare but I saw
don't see that that makes them
particularly valuable
I don't even find them particularly
beautiful to look at I'd rather see a
ruby or a sapphire or something like
that or even colored glass I think that
looks fantastic but diamonds diamonds
just don't do it for me that would have
made a great Bond film wouldn't it
diamonds don't do it for me probably
wouldn't last very long
